etymology.description: semantic 木 (“wood”) + phonetic 公 (OC *kloːŋ); OC for 松 *sɢloŋ.
etymology.interpretation: 木 flags the meaning domain of trees/wood, fitting the sense of “pine.” 公 supplies the approximate sound, guiding pronunciation while contributing little to meaning.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 鬆 (“loose, relax”) was merged into 松 in Simplified Chinese, leveraging the existing tree character to reduce strokes and unify a near-homophone; the ‘pine’ sense was already 松 in Traditional.

examples.chinese: 这片山上有很多松树(這片山上有很多松樹)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piàn shān shang yǒu hěn duō sōngshù.
examples.english: There are many pine trees on this mountain.

examples.chinese: 工人把螺丝拧松了(工人把螺絲擰鬆了)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngrén bǎ luósī nǐng sōng le.

examples.chinese: 周末放松一下(週末放鬆一下)。
examples.english: Relax a bit on the weekend.
